options.title: Conventional IVF
options.subtitle: Sperm and fresh donor eggs mixed together

options.title: ICSI
options.subtitle: Single sperm injected into each donor egg

questions.question: What fertilization method will be used?
questions.description: Choose between conventional IVF or ICSI

options.title: ICSI
options.subtitle: Single sperm injected into each egg

questions.question: Will you be doing genetic testing on embryos?
questions.description: PGT requires embryo biopsy - ICSI is recommended for all PGT cases to ensure optimal fertilization

options.title: PGT-A (Aneuploidy)
options.subtitle: Screen for chromosome abnormalities - ICSI recommended

options.title: PGT-M (Monogenic)
options.subtitle: Test for specific genetic disorders - ICSI recommended

options.title: PGT-SR (Structural Rearrangement)
options.subtitle: Screen for structural abnormalities - ICSI recommended

questions.question: Fertilization method for PGT testing
questions.description: For PGT testing, ICSI is strongly recommended to optimize fertilization and embryo development

options.title: ICSI (Recommended)
options.subtitle: Best success rates with PGT - single sperm injection

options.title: Conventional IVF
options.subtitle: Higher risk of fertilization issues with PGT

questions.question: Will you be carrying the pregnancy yourself?
questions.description: Determine if a gestational surrogate will be needed

options.subtitle: I will carry the pregnancy myself

options.title: No, Using a Gestational Surrogate
options.subtitle: A surrogate will carry the pregnancy

paths.title: IUI With Partner Sperm
paths.description: Intrauterine insemination using sperm from your partner
paths.recommended_for: Couples with unexplained infertility, mild male factor, or ovulation issues

steps.overview: Comprehensive fertility evaluation for both partners
Early-cycle ultrasound and labs to confirm readiness
Decide on natural monitoring vs. medication to stimulate ovulation
Track follicle growth with ultrasound and hormone levels
Time insemination using hCG trigger or natural LH surge
Collect and prepare sperm sample on day of IUI
Place prepared sperm into uterine cavity

paths.title: IUI With Donor Sperm
paths.description: Intrauterine insemination using donor sperm
paths.recommended_for: Single individuals, same-sex couples, or severe male factor infertility

steps.overview: Psychological counseling and choosing a sperm donor
Complete legal documentation for donor sperm use

paths.title: IVF With Personal Eggs & Partner Sperm
paths.description: Standard IVF using your own eggs and partner's sperm
paths.recommended_for: Couples with tubal factor, endometriosis, or failed IUI

paths.title: IVF With Personal Eggs & Donor Sperm
paths.description: IVF using your own eggs and donor sperm
paths.recommended_for: Single individuals or couples with severe male factor

paths.title: IVF With Donor Eggs
paths.description: IVF using eggs from a donor
paths.recommended_for: Advanced maternal age, poor egg quality, or genetic concerns

paths.title: Double Donation IVF
paths.description: IVF using both donor eggs and donor sperm
paths.recommended_for: Couples with both partners having fertility issues

steps.overview: Select both egg and sperm donors

paths.title: Reciprocal IVF
paths.description: One partner provides eggs, the other carries the pregnancy
paths.recommended_for: Same-sex female couples wanting both partners involved

paths.title: IVF With Gestational Carrier (Surrogacy)
paths.description: Using a surrogate to carry your pregnancy
paths.recommended_for: Absent/abnormal uterus, medical conditions, or recurrent pregnancy loss

steps.overview: Find carrier and complete legal agreements

paths.title: Sperm Freezing
paths.description: Preserve male fertility by freezing sperm
paths.recommended_for: Before cancer treatment, vasectomy, or advancing age

paths.title: Egg Freezing
paths.description: Preserve fertility by freezing unfertilized eggs
paths.recommended_for: Delaying childbearing, before cancer treatment, or medical conditions

paths.title: Embryo Freezing With Partner
paths.description: Create and freeze embryos with partner's sperm
paths.recommended_for: Couples planning to delay pregnancy

steps.overview: Plan for when to use frozen embryos

paths.title: Embryo Freezing With Donor Sperm
paths.description: Create and freeze embryos using donor sperm
paths.recommended_for: Single individuals wanting embryos for future use

steps.overview: Plan for when to transfer frozen embryos

paths.title: Emergency Fertility Preservation
paths.description: Rapid preservation before cancer treatment
paths.recommended_for: Cancer patients needing immediate treatment

steps.overview: Begin stimulation regardless of cycle day

paths.title: Ovarian Tissue Cryopreservation
paths.description: Experimental preservation of ovarian tissue
paths.recommended_for: Prepubertal girls or when time doesn't allow for egg freezing

paths.title: Prepubertal Fertility Preservation
paths.description: Experimental options for children
paths.recommended_for: Children facing gonadotoxic treatments

paths.title: Anonymous Embryo Donation Cycle
paths.description: Using pre-created embryos from anonymous donors
paths.recommended_for: Patients requiring donor embryos from anonymous sources

steps.overview: Prepare uterine lining for embryo transfer

paths.title: Directed Embryo Donation Cycle
paths.description: Using pre-created embryos from known donors
paths.recommended_for: Patients with known embryo donors

steps.overview: Consultation and coordination with known donors
Prepare uterine lining for embryo transfer

paths.title: Fresh IVF Cycle - Conventional Fertilization
paths.description: IVF using fresh eggs with conventional fertilization
paths.recommended_for: Patients with fresh eggs and adequate sperm parameters

steps.overview: Track follicle growth and trigger ovulation
Retrieve eggs and perform conventional IVF
Culture embryos and transfer to uterus
topic_refs: Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Three (Cleavage Stage)
Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Five (Blastocyst Stage)

paths.title: Fresh IVF Cycle - ICSI
paths.description: IVF using fresh eggs with ICSI fertilization
paths.recommended_for: Patients with male factor infertility or previous fertilization failure

steps.overview: Track follicle growth and trigger ovulation
Retrieve eggs and perform ICSI fertilization
Culture embryos and transfer to uterus
topic_refs: Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Three (Cleavage Stage)
Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Five (Blastocyst Stage)

paths.title: Frozen Egg IVF - Partner Sperm with ICSI
paths.description: IVF using previously frozen eggs with partner sperm and ICSI
paths.recommended_for: Patients using their own frozen eggs with partner sperm

steps.overview: Review frozen egg inventory and cycle planning
Prepare for frozen egg thaw and transfer cycle
Thaw frozen eggs and perform ICSI (required for frozen eggs)
Culture embryos and transfer to uterus

paths.title: Frozen Egg IVF - Donor Sperm with ICSI
paths.description: IVF using previously frozen eggs with donor sperm and ICSI
paths.recommended_for: Patients using their own frozen eggs with donor sperm

steps.overview: Review frozen egg inventory and select donor sperm
Prepare for frozen egg thaw and transfer cycle
Thaw frozen eggs and perform ICSI with donor sperm
Culture embryos and transfer to uterus

paths.title: Donor Egg IVF with ICSI
paths.description: IVF using previously frozen donor eggs with ICSI fertilization
paths.recommended_for: Patients using donor eggs (ICSI required due to frozen eggs)

steps.overview: Consultation and egg donor selection process
Prepare recipient cycle for frozen donor eggs
Thaw frozen donor eggs and perform ICSI
Culture embryos and transfer to recipient

paths.title: Fresh Directed Donor Egg IVF - Conventional Fertilization
paths.description: IVF using fresh directed donor eggs with conventional fertilization
paths.recommended_for: Patients using fresh directed donor eggs with adequate sperm parameters

steps.overview: Consultation and coordination with known donor
Legal contracts and medical screening for both parties
Synchronize recipient and donor cycles for fresh transfer
Retrieve fresh donor eggs and perform conventional fertilization
Culture embryos and transfer to recipient
topic_refs: Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Three (Cleavage Stage)
Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Five (Blastocyst Stage)

paths.title: Fresh Directed Donor Egg IVF - ICSI
paths.description: IVF using fresh directed donor eggs with ICSI fertilization
paths.recommended_for: Patients using fresh directed donor eggs with male factor infertility

steps.overview: Consultation and coordination with known donor
Legal contracts and medical screening for both parties
Synchronize recipient and donor cycles for fresh transfer
Retrieve fresh donor eggs and perform ICSI
Culture embryos and transfer to recipient
topic_refs: Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Three (Cleavage Stage)
Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Five (Blastocyst Stage)

paths.title: IVF Cycle - Self Carry
paths.description: Complete IVF cycle where you carry the pregnancy yourself, with optional genetic testing
paths.recommended_for: Patients who can carry their own pregnancy

steps.overview: Complete pre-cycle preparation and baseline monitoring
Ovarian stimulation and cycle monitoring (if using fresh eggs)
Embryo culture, development monitoring, and optional genetic testing

topic_refs: Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Three (Cleavage Stage)
Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Five (Blastocyst Stage)

paths.title: IVF Cycle - Gestational Surrogacy
paths.description: IVF cycle using a gestational surrogate to carry the pregnancy, with optional genetic testing
paths.recommended_for: Patients who cannot carry a pregnancy or have medical contraindications

steps.overview: Find and legally contract with a gestational surrogate
Medical and psychological screening for intended parents and surrogate
Coordinate cycles between intended mother and surrogate
Retrieve eggs from intended mother (or donor) and fertilize
Culture embryos and optional genetic testing (PGT-A, PGT-M, PGT-SR)

topic_refs: Fresh Embryo Transfer - Day Five (Blastocyst Stage)

steps.overview: Support surrogate through pregnancy with coordinated care

paths.title: Sperm Freezing - Partner Travel
paths.description: Preserve sperm when partner is unavailable during treatment
paths.recommended_for: Partners who will be traveling or unavailable during fertility treatment cycles

steps.overview: Plan for future use in treatment cycles

paths.title: Sperm Freezing - Medical Reasons
paths.description: Preserve sperm due to medical conditions or declining quality
paths.recommended_for: Men with declining sperm quality, varicocele, or other medical conditions affecting fertility

steps.overview: Detailed assessment of male fertility factors
Collect several samples to maximize preservation
Special processing for poor quality samples
Establish storage and future use plans

paths.title: Sperm Banking Before Vasectomy
paths.description: Preserve fertility before planned permanent sterilization
paths.recommended_for: Men planning vasectomy who may want future children

paths.title: Social Egg Freezing
paths.description: Elective egg preservation for future family planning
paths.recommended_for: Women wanting to preserve fertility for future use

steps.overview: Discuss options, success rates, and expectations
Evaluate ovarian reserve and overall fertility
Stimulate ovaries to produce multiple eggs
Vitrify and store eggs for future use
Plan for when and how to use frozen eggs

paths.title: Career-Focused Egg Freezing
paths.description: Preserve eggs while focusing on career development
paths.recommended_for: Women prioritizing career or education goals

steps.overview: Discuss optimal timing for preservation and future use
Comprehensive evaluation of current fertility status
Retrieve and freeze eggs with minimal career disruption
Plan optimal timing for using eggs in future career phases

paths.title: Single Woman Egg Freezing
paths.description: Preserve eggs while looking for the right partner
paths.recommended_for: Single women wanting to preserve fertility options

steps.overview: Discuss options and timeline as a single woman
Retrieve and preserve eggs for future use
Plan for using eggs when ready to build family

paths.title: Medical Egg Freezing
paths.description: Preserve eggs due to medical conditions affecting fertility
paths.recommended_for: Women with medical conditions that may impact future fertility

steps.overview: Evaluate medical condition's impact on fertility
Plan for using preserved eggs when medically appropriate

paths.title: Gender Transition - Sperm Preservation
paths.description: Preserve sperm before starting hormone therapy or gender-affirming surgery
paths.recommended_for: Transgender men or non-binary individuals assigned male at birth

steps.overview: Discuss preservation options in affirming environment
Plan for potential future family building

paths.title: Sperm Preservation - On Testosterone
paths.description: Preserve fertility for individuals already on hormone therapy
paths.recommended_for: Transgender men already on testosterone who want fertility preservation

steps.overview: Consider temporary hormone modifications if needed
Preserve gametes and plan future use

paths.title: Egg Preservation - On Estrogen
paths.description: Preserve fertility for individuals on feminizing hormone therapy
paths.recommended_for: Transgender women on estrogen who want fertility preservation

steps.overview: Evaluate estrogen therapy effects on fertility
Plan for future family building options

paths.title: Emergency Oncofertility Protocol
paths.description: Fast-track fertility preservation before urgent cancer treatment
paths.recommended_for: Patients starting cancer treatment within 2 weeks

steps.overview: Fast-track ovarian stimulation or sperm collection
Immediate egg retrieval or sperm collection

paths.title: Male Oncofertility - Sperm Banking
paths.description: Preserve sperm before cancer treatment
paths.recommended_for: Men facing chemotherapy or radiation therapy

steps.overview: Discuss fertility risks and preservation options
Plan for fertility recovery and future use

paths.title: Excess Embryo Freezing
paths.description: Preserve extra embryos from IVF cycle
paths.recommended_for: Couples with extra good-quality embryos from IVF

steps.overview: Plan for using frozen embryos in future cycles

paths.title: Embryo Freezing for Genetic Testing
paths.description: Freeze embryos while awaiting PGT results
paths.recommended_for: Couples doing genetic testing on embryos

steps.overview: Take cells from embryos for testing
Wait for and review PGT results

paths.title: Medical Embryo Freezing
paths.description: Freeze embryos due to medical reasons preventing transfer
paths.recommended_for: Patients who cannot transfer embryos due to medical issues

paths.title: Embryo Banking for Future Siblings
paths.description: Preserve embryos specifically for future children
paths.recommended_for: Couples planning multiple children from one IVF cycle

steps.overview: Discuss desired family size and timing

paths.title: Oncofertility - Egg Freezing
paths.description: Emergency egg freezing before cancer treatment
paths.recommended_for: Women with 2-4 weeks before cancer treatment starts

paths.title: Oncofertility - Embryo Freezing (Partner)
paths.description: Emergency embryo creation and freezing with partner's sperm
paths.recommended_for: Women with partners, 2-4 weeks before cancer treatment

steps.overview: Joint counseling and rapid decision making
Coordinate female stimulation and male sample collection

paths.title: Oncofertility - Embryo Freezing (Donor)
paths.description: Emergency embryo creation with donor sperm before cancer treatment
paths.recommended_for: Single women or those without partner availability

steps.overview: Rapid donor sperm selection and procurement
Fast-track egg maturation while securing donor sperm
Egg retrieval and immediate fertilization with donor sperm

paths.title: Oncofertility - Ovarian Tissue Freezing
paths.description: Experimental ovarian tissue preservation for immediate cancer treatment
paths.recommended_for: Women needing immediate cancer treatment, prepubertal patients

steps.overview: Discuss experimental nature and obtain informed consent
